In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the solution to your problem:

```julia
function wrap_string(s, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(s, ' ')
    result = ""
    for word in words
        if length(result) + length(word) > text_width && !isempty(result)
            result *= "\n"
        end
        result *= "$word "
    end
    return result
end
```
This function works by splitting the input string into an array of words. Then, it iterates over each word. If adding the length of the current word to the length of the result string would exceed `text_width`, a new line is added to the result string. After that, the word is appended to the result string.

Let's see an example:
```julia
println(wrap_string("This is a test text for wrapping", 10))
```
Output:
```
This is a 
test text 
for 
wrapping
```
